section.name: module
section.p: A module is a collection of projects that are physically stored in a single repository.

tr.td: Override the cvs tag to be used.

subsection.name: url
subsection.p: This is the homepage for the collection of projects contained in this module. This element is optional, but if present, will be referenced in the generated web pages containing build results.
Note: give the way that Gump uses href to specify definitions which are to be inlined, the design of this element is rather unfortunate. Perhaps it should be replaced with a <home-page> element.

tr.td: The directory (relative to the workspace's basedir) which the checked out sources are to be copied for build purposes.
No. Defaults to the name of the module.

subsection.name: description
subsection.p: If present, will contain information added to the title in web pages containing build results.

subsection.name: cvs
subsection.p: References the repository in which this project resides. May also contain various overrides.
Note: as the long term plans is to make Gump handle many different types of repository types, the name of this element should ultimately change

tr.td: The name of the repository in which this module resides.
Additional information which will be added in the front of the host name. Useful for repositories like sorceforge which define a separate virtual host for every project
The subdirectory in which the cvs module is present. Useful for repositories like developerworks which organize related modules into directories.
An override for the name of the cvs module.
No. Defaults to the name of the module.
Set the compression level. Some CVS client/server combinations will not work with compression.
No. Defaults to the compress value for the repository

subsection.name: svn
subsection.p: References a Subversion repository in which this project resides.

tr.td: The url of the repository in which this module resides.

subsection.name: project
subsection.p: A definition of a project which is physically contained in this module.

subsection.name: redistributable
subsection.p: If present, indicates that outputs of builds from this module are redistributable. Defaults to the redistributable value for the repository.
